sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Posts a reply to the specified message.

Inputs :

  • Group ID / Team ID - Unique ID of the Team.
  • Channel ID - Unique ID of the Channel.
  • Message ID - Unique ID of the Message to which the reply is to be posted.
  • Message - Message to be posted in the channel.An entity can be mentioned in the message using tag. To mention an entity, following is the syntax: 
         
Mention Text     
For example: Test User
Here 'Test User' is the entity to 
be mentioned.
    For mention to work, required details must be provided in Mentions input. Mentions input must contain the details of the mentioned enitites in the same order as they appear in the message, which means if Test User is the first mentioned entity, then it must be added to Mentions input as first item.
  • Inline Image Attachment - Attachment record to be attached to the message.
  • Inline Image Attachment Type - Content-Type of the inline image attachment.
  • SharePoint Attachment - Attachment to be added as reference document along with the message. File must already be in SharePoint. Following are the fields for the object:
    • Attachment ID
    • Attachment Name
    • Content URL
  • Mentions - List of objects containing these values
    • Mention Text - Text used in Message to mention the entity.
    • Type - Type of entity to be mentioned.
    • Mentioned - Details of the mentioned entity. Provide value for one of the following depending upon Type of entity.
      • Application
        • Application ID
        • Display Name
        • Application Identity Type
      • User
        • User ID
        • Display Name
        • User Identity Type
      • Conversation
        • Conversation ID
        • Display Name
        • Conversation Identity Type

Note: To find the Sharepoint file properties, following are the two ways:

  1. Look up the Drive Item for the file. For example, using GET /drives/{id}/items/{id} or /drives/{id}/root:/path with https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0 as the base URL. Attachment ID is the GUID in the eTag of the driveItem(if eTag is "\"{06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2},6\"", then Attachment ID is 06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2), Content URL is the webUrl of the driveItem's folder, and Attachment Name is the driveItem's name.
  2. Using Look up Files action in Microsoft Sharepoint Spoke. From file output object, Name is the Attachment Name, URL is the Content URL and Attachment ID is the GUID in the Etag of the file object. If Etag is "\"{06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2},6\"", then Attachment ID is 06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2.


Outputs :

  • Message ID - Unique ID of the Message.
  • Action Status - An object with the following fields:
    • Code - If the request is executed successfully, code will be set to 0 but if the request failed, code will be set to 1.
    • Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages :

  • Unauthorized.
  • Access token is empty. Please Check Oauth Token and scope permission.
  • One or more inputs are invalid.
  • Invalid Team ID.
  • Invalid Message ID.
  • Invalid Attachment ID for Sharepoint Attachment.

To use this action, the corresponding Microsoft Teams Graph connection and credential must be created and associated with the Microsoft Teams Graph Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
Posts a reply to the specified message.

Inputs :

  • Group ID / Team ID - Unique ID of the Team.
  • Channel ID - Unique ID of the Channel.
  • Message ID - Unique ID of the Message to which the reply is to be posted.
  • Message - Message to be posted in the channel.An entity can be mentioned in the message using tag. To mention an entity, following is the syntax: 
         
Mention Text     
For example: Test User
Here 'Test User' is the entity to 
be mentioned.
    For mention to work, required details must be provided in Mentions input. Mentions input must contain the details of the mentioned enitites in the same order as they appear in the message, which means if Test User is the first mentioned entity, then it must be added to Mentions input as first item.
  • Inline Image Attachment - Attachment record to be attached to the message.
  • Inline Image Attachment Type - Content-Type of the inline image attachment.
  • SharePoint Attachment - Attachment to be added as reference document along with the message. File must already be in SharePoint. Following are the fields for the object:
    • Attachment ID
    • Attachment Name
    • Content URL
  • Mentions - List of objects containing these values
    • Mention Text - Text used in Message to mention the entity.
    • Type - Type of entity to be mentioned.
    • Mentioned - Details of the mentioned entity. Provide value for one of the following depending upon Type of entity.
      • Application
        • Application ID
        • Display Name
        • Application Identity Type
      • User
        • User ID
        • Display Name
        • User Identity Type
      • Conversation
        • Conversation ID
        • Display Name
        • Conversation Identity Type

Note: To find the Sharepoint file properties, following are the two ways:

  1. Look up the Drive Item for the file. For example, using GET /drives/{id}/items/{id} or /drives/{id}/root:/path with https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0 as the base URL. Attachment ID is the GUID in the eTag of the driveItem(if eTag is "\"{06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2},6\"", then Attachment ID is 06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2), Content URL is the webUrl of the driveItem's folder, and Attachment Name is the driveItem's name.
  2. Using Look up Files action in Microsoft Sharepoint Spoke. From file output object, Name is the Attachment Name, URL is the Content URL and Attachment ID is the GUID in the Etag of the file object. If Etag is "\"{06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2},6\"", then Attachment ID is 06C5709E-B33A-4B07-8363-03ED1BCB53E2.


Outputs :

  • Message ID - Unique ID of the Message.
  • Action Status - An object with the following fields:
    • Code - If the request is executed successfully, code will be set to 0 but if the request failed, code will be set to 1.
    • Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages :

  • Unauthorized.
  • Access token is empty. Please Check Oauth Token and scope permission.
  • One or more inputs are invalid.
  • Invalid Team ID.
  • Invalid Message ID.
  • Invalid Attachment ID for Sharepoint Attachment.

To use this action, the corresponding Microsoft Teams Graph connection and credential must be created and associated with the Microsoft Teams Graph Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
